SUMMARY: RstA appears to control genes involved in different biological processes, such as acid tolerance, curli fimbria formation, and anaerobic respiration, among ors [17468243]. Some phenotypes caused by RstA have been identified by mutational analysis. For example, RstA is a suppressor of a lesion in yjeE, a gene essential for cell growth and whose cellular function is unknown [17293428]. RstA overproduction causes drug resistance [12618449, 12951338]. RstA belongs to two-component system RstA/RstB [15522865]. Both genes, rstA, encoding response regulator, and rstB, encoding sensor kinase, are transcribed toger in an operon that is induced under low-Mg2+ growth conditions through PhoP/PhoQ two-component system [12813061]. autophosphorylation of RstB appears to be stimulated by low pH [17468243, 15522865]. Subsequently, phosphate group is transferred from RstB to RstA to activate it [15522865]. A 14-bp DNA sequence that contains TACA direct repeat has been identified as RstA DNA-binding site and is called RstA box [17468243].
